text: Part of my script is taking values and putting them to a text file delimited by tabs.

code:
for linesplit in fileList:
    for i in range (0, len(linesplit)):
        t.write (linesplit[i]+'\t')

text: I get as an output in the file what I expect in the first line but in the following lines they all start with a \t in them, like is:

code:
value1    value2    value3
    value1    value2    value3
    value1    value2    value3

text: Also, why don't I need to add a t.write('\n') after the second FOR loop to create the newlines?
I would expect the code above to produce one long line of tab separated values but it doesn't.
If I include the t.write('\n') then the tabs issue is resolved but I get double '\n'...
